did.unittitle: Office of the Dean, School of Medicine Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Office of the Dean of the School of Medicine

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in five series: Liaison Committee on Medical Education (LCME) accreditation records; Departmental annual reports; Meeting minutes; Subject files; and Unprocessed accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Medical School and Dental School were jointly administered by one Dean until 1914, when the Office of the Vice-Dean was created in the Medical School. The Dental School added its own Vice-Dean in 1915, and then in 1917 appointed its own Dean, thereby separating the administration of the two schools. The Medical School was renamed the School of Medicine in 1954 when Tufts College became Tufts University.

Subsequently, the Office of the Dean has been involved in numerous transitional processes for the continuously expanding School of Medicine. Particularly, Deans have been involved in the creation and administration of the Tufts Medical Center as it has gradually acquired additional facilities and resources in the downtown area.

The Office of the Dean of the School of Medicine administers the academic departments, student services, and facilities of the Tufts University School of Medicine, and supervises the School's teaching and research activities. The Office of the Dean performs a variety of tasks to fulfill its larger objectives, such as recruitment of new faculty and strategic and financial planning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records, reports, and meeting minutes created by the Office of the Dean, School of Medicine.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

did.unittitle: Liaison Committee on Medical Education (LCME) accreditation records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records created during the LCME accreditation process, including planning documents, self-studies, reports, recommendations, and revisit reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes LCME materials from the 1987 accreditation revisit, the 1995 TUSM Strategic Plan Draft Report, and August 20, 1996 LCME Secretariat interim visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains the 1999 LCME Survey Report, 1999 TUSM Self-study Summary Report and Committee Reports, final 1999 LCME database submitted to the Site Visit Team (five volumes), chart of events for 2004-2006 accreditation process, 2006 final LCME Survey Report and accreditation decision, LCME publications and background documents, and final 2006 LCME database submitted to the Site Visit Team (five volumes).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains TUSM resources (Student Handbook, Faculty Handbook, Guide to Third Year, and Electives for Fourth Year), 2005-2006; LCME materials from 2013-2014 accreditation process.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains annual reports submitted to the Dean by various School of Medicine departments.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by name of department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Annual reports submitted to the Dean by the Departments of Anatomy and Cellular Biology, Anesthesiology, Biochemistry, Family Medicine and Community Health, Emergency Medicine, Medicine, and Molecular Biology and Microbiology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Annual reports submitted to the Dean by the Departments of Nephrology, Neurology, Neuroscience, Neurosurgery, Obstetrics and Gynecology, Opthamology, Orthopaedics, Otolaryngology, Pathology, Pediatrics, Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics, Physiology, Psychiatry, Public Health and Family Medicine, and Tufts New England Medical Center/Tufts University School of Medicine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes minutes of the Board of Trustees, Committee on Committees, Executive Council, Faculty Affairs Committee, General Faculty, and Scientific Affairs Committee. Also included are meeting agendas and memos related to committee membership and structure.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by creator (committee, board, or council).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Minutes of the Board of Trustees (including Trustee Academic Affairs Committee, Administration and Finance Committee, and Executive Committee), 1984-2001; Committee on Committees, 1993-1994; Executive Council, 1998-2003; Faculty Affairs Committee, 1988-1994; General Faculty, 1994-2003; and Scientific Affairs Committee, 1990-1991.
Also included are meeting agendas and memos related to committee membership and structure.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes files on agreements with TUSM-affiliated hospitals; the Bingham Program; Clinical Study Unit; Deaconess; the Frank Stella painting "Bogoria," 1971; gifts and bequests; various foundations, trusts, and funding organizations; LCME accreditation studies and reports, 1991-1995; and marketing communications plan, 1999.

The folder titled "Correspondence from Dr. Henry Banks's vertical file, 1980-1989" was retrieved by Eliot Wilczek, Records Manager, from discards of the Dr. Banks vertical files in the Health Sciences Library. Dr. Banks historically received records and documentation from the Office of the Dean for his research, and maintained a vertical file of topics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes files on the Mary Y. Lee Medical Education Research Day, 2008; MIT-Tufts; Morris Cynkin Prize in Biochemistry; National Fund for Medical Education; patent and copyright policy, 1975-1987; various foundations, trusts, and funding organizations; Pew programs; Porter Prize, 1998; Posner Hall; Sackler School; and various reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes files on the Segal Lectureship; Singapore; strategic planning retreat, 2004; Maurice B. Strauss Professorship; Sweeney Scholarship; Sterling Drug, Inc. Visiting Professorship; Tufts Associated Health Plan; Tufts-MIT agreement; Tufts-NEMC Cancer Center; Veterans Affairs; the Veterinary School; and various foundations, trusts, and funding organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trustees records are open for research. This series may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.
